intro: Verbascum barradense, commonly known as the Barraden’s mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
